etymology.description: semantic: 𤣩 “jade” + phonetic: 豖; the phonetic depicts a castrated boar and may also suggest the idea of cutting.
etymology.interpretation: Jade marks the domain of meaning: working with jade. The phonetic 豖 gives the sound and, being associated with cutting (castration), reinforces the sense of carving/polishing.

examples.chinese: 工匠细心琢玉(工匠細心琢玉)。
雕琢玉器需要高超的技艺(雕琢玉器需要高超的技藝)。
examples.pinyin: Diāozhuó yùqì xūyào gāochāo de jìyì.
examples.english: Carving jade artifacts requires superb craftsmanship.

examples.chinese: 这段文字过于雕琢，显得不自然(這段文字過於雕琢，顯得不自然)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè duàn wénzì guòyú diāozhuó, xiǎnde bù zìrán.
examples.english: This passage is overly polished and feels unnatural.
